title.en: Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile (CHAD-AP)

comments.en: The Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile (CHAD-AP, https://w3id.org/dharc/ontology/chad-ap) is a CIDOC CRM application profile implemented as an OWL ontology that can be logically split into two separate abstract modules: the Object Module (OM), dedicated to describing the CH objects, and the Process Module (PM), for describing the acquisition and digitisation process.

abstract.value: A OWL 2 DL-based metadata application profile for describing cultural heritage digitisation data and processes in a FAIR-compliant and machine-readable format.

title.value: Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile (CHAD-AP)

bibliographicCitation.value: Barzaghi, S., Heibi, I., Moretti, A., Peroni, S. (2025). Developing Application Profiles for Enhancing Data and Workflows in Cultural Heritage Digitisation Processes. In: Demartini, G., et al. The Semantic Web - ISWC 2024. ISWC 2024. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 15233. Springer, Cham. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-77847-6_11.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crm:P14_carried_out_by -[1..N]-> crm:E39_Actor
* crm:P16_used_specific_object -[0..N]-> lrmoo:F5_Item
* crm:P32_used_general_technique -[0..N]-> E55_Type

rationale.value: This class consists in a generic action carried out by one or more actors. An activity should at least be typified (through the combination of crm:P2_has_type and AAT) and assigned to its respective actors, although its properties may vary depending on the type of activity.

comment.en: An action intentionally carried out by one or more actors.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the optimisation phase of a digitisation process.

comment.en: Reduction of data needed for storage or transmission. Data is reduced in volume by means of encoding information to require fewer bits to be stored than the original.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are incunambula.

comment.en: Books printed before 1501.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are rattles.

comment.en: Shaken idiophones made in a variety of forms worldwide, in which one or more objects strike against each other or against the inside or outside of another object.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are series of frescoes.

comment.en: Sets or ensembles of visual works.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are watercolor paintings.

comment.en: Transparent aqueous based paint produced by mixing ground pigments with water and, generally, gum arabic.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are lamps.

comment.en: Lighting devices having a vessel to contain fuel used as a source of illumination, such as grease or oil.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent identifiers that are issued by the institution.

comment.en: Numeric, alphanumeric, or other identifying codes assigned when an art object, book, or other item enters the collection of a museum, library, or other repository.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of watercolor as a technique.

comment.en: Watercolor painting done in transparent washes of color as distinguished from the opaque method using gouache.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of authors.

comment.en: The activities surrounding the production or conception of a work, particularly a work of visual art, literary art, or performing arts.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of printers.

comment.en: Various means of reproducing identical copies of graphic matter in a fixed form, by which an image, pictorial or textual, is transferred, usually to paper or cloth.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of discoverers.

comment.en: Events or activities of finding out or becoming aware of something that had been lost, forgotten, or previously unknown. Includes the finding of archaeological objects, lost buildings, places.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of wax modeling as a technique.

comment.en: Any technique for forming or shaping wax into sculptural shapes, either for casting purposes or as a final work.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are statues.

comment.en: Sculpture in the round, usually but not always depicting humans, animals, mythical beings, or small figure groups.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are manuscript volumes.

comment.en: Manuscript volumes comprising two or more works, whether referring to only the content combined or to the combination of physically separate leafs or gatherings that are sewn or tipped in

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are manuscripts.

comment.en: Handwritten documents, particularly books and other documents created before the invention of the printing press.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of drying as a technique.

comment.en: Making free or nearly free of liquids.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent collections.

comment.en: Accumulated groups of objects or materials having a focal characteristic and that have been brought together by an individual or organization.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are illuminated manuscripts.

comment.en: Handwritten manuscripts that have been decorated with gold or silver, brilliant colors, designs, or miniature pictures.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent identifiers that are shelf marks.

comment.en: Identifying numeric or alpha codes found, usually on the spine, of a manuscript, book or other volume, giving the location where the item can be found in the library.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are engravings.

comment.en: Prints on paper incorporating impressions of a reverse design created on a printing plate, usually copper, into which the design has been incised (engraved) using burins or gravers.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are videos.

comment.en: Manifestations of motion pictures, stored electronically, in any media or digitized format.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of vase painting as a technique.

comment.en: The process and technique of creating two-dimensional decoration on pottery by using paint made of metallic oxides or other pigments held in suspension in slip or another medium.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of translators.

comment.en: The activity of comprehending, analyzing, and expressing written or spoken material in a different language from the original.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are dioramas.

comment.en: Works in which three-dimensional objects, often figural sculpture, in the foreground blend with a realistic painted background.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are axes.

comment.en: A category of handheld tools or weapons characterized by a sharp-edged blade attached to a handle, typically made of wood or metal.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent titles that are the original denominations of their CHOs.

comment.en: Titles or names that were originally assigned to a work or assigned soon after its creation. It may refer to a former title or to a title that has been translated.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are artifacts.

comment.en: Generally, objects or other things made or modified by humans, typically manually portable products of human workmanship, such as tools, utensils, objects for personal adornment, or art.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are bottles.

comment.en: Vessels having a neck and mouth considerably narrower than the body, used for packaging and containing liquid and dry preparations.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent titles that are the denominations used during the exhibition to identify their CHOs.

comment.en: For art cataloging, titles or names by which the work has been known in exhibitions, particularly when different from titles by which the work is normally known.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are gems.

comment.en: Works comprising precious or semiprecious stones or other materials such as amber or pearl, cut, polished, or otherwise dressed for ornamental purposes to be used in jewelry, seals, or amulets.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the modelling phase of a digitisation process.

comment.en: Computer software technique for rendering virtual models of surfaces in three-dimensions.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of museum preparators.

comment.en: The action or process of making something ready for use or service or of getting ready for some occasion, test, or duty.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are series of paintings.

comment.en: Refers to series of visual works depicting events and unified by a common topic, not necessarily a sequence in a single story line.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of intarsia as a technique.

comment.en: Decorative wood process in which the design or pattern is made by assembling small pieces of veneer in various shapes.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are charm pendants.

comment.en: A small decorative item, often made of metal or other materials, that is attached to a necklace or bracelet.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are series of prints.

comment.en: Groups of prints related in theme or technique and usually issued together.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are electrostatic machines.

comment.en: Machines for the production of electrical discharge at high voltage.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are necklaces.

comment.en: Ornaments worn around the neck, usually in the form of chains or strands of beads, pearls, stones, or decorative or precious materials, and often including a suspended ornamental pendant.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the publication phase in a digitisation process.

comment.en: Publishing text or images in electronic machine-readable formats.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are bibliographic series.

comment.en: A conceptual grouping of visual arts works, literary works, or performance art created in succession by the same author, artist, or studio and intended by the creator(s) to be seen together.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are paintings.

comment.en: Unique works in which images are formed primarily by the direct application of pigments suspended in oil, water, egg yolk, molten wax, or other liquid, arranged in masses of color, onto a general surface.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of mosaics as a technique.

comment.en: A method of decorating surfaces with patterns or pictures composed of small, regularly-shaped pieces of colored durable material, such as stone or glass.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are spark arresters.

comment.en: Instruments used to discharge a capacitor, which is a device capable of storing energy within an electrostatic field.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are prints.

comment.en: Pictorial works produced by transferring images by means of a matrix such as a plate, block, or screen, using any of various printing processes.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are microscopes.

comment.en: Optical instruments consisting of a lens or combination of lenses that allow the viewing of objects that are too small to be seen with the naked, unaided eye.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of photogrammetry as a technique.

comment.en: Refers to the technique of making measurements by using photography. It usually refers to this technique as applied to mapmaking, measuring site elements, and surveying.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of drawing as a technique.

comment.en: Producing visible forms primarily by delineation, usually by the direct application of material or instrument to the surface of the support.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of letterpress printing as a technique.

comment.en: Printing from raised and inked type, distinguished from lithographic or intaglio printing, particularly in the context of book and other text printing.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of commissioners.

comment.en: Method of acquiring property by request from the creator or producer.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of engravers.

comment.en: The intaglio process in which the design is incised into a printing plate, usually a flat copper plate, with the aid of a graver or burin.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are molds.

comment.en: Hollow forms in which castings or pressings are made; used with many materials, including clay, metal, glass, and paper.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of structured light scanning as a technique.

comment.en: Scanning technique that involves a pattern of lines projected onto a 3-D object and the subsequent mathematical measurement of the deformations caused by the geometry of the object.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are pieces of equipment.

comment.en: Articles or physical resources used to array, dress up, rig out, equip, or otherwise provide with what is requisite for efficient action by a person or animal or for a thing.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent identifiers that are volume numbers.

comment.en: Numbers used to identify an individual publication within a classification or location in a library.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent curation activities.

comment.en: Superintending or managing the collections, exhibitions, research activities, and personnel of a museum, art gallery, zoo, or other place of exhibit; also, the superintending or managing of a single collection.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are navigation charts.

comment.en: Maps designed and used primarily for plotting courses and traveling on water in a ship or other vessel or in an aircraft or spacecraft.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are compasses.

comment.en: Instruments for drawing circles and measuring the distance between two points.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are vases.

comment.en: Vessels of varying shape and size but which are usually taller than they are wide, varying greatly in actual form and use.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are masks.

comment.en: Refers to coverings for all or part of the face, usually with openings for the eyes and sometimes the mouth.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are specimens.

comment.en: A specimen is an individual instance that represents a class. A good specimen shows the character of the thing or material, useful for close study and permitting exact identification.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent subjects of a CHO.

comment.en: In the visual arts, oral works, music, performing arts, and literature, the topics, themes, or other visual, oral, or written content of the work. It includes what the work is of or about.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent digital devices that are optical scanners.

comment.en: A device that captures images or text documents and converts them into digital data that can be processed by a computer. These scanners use optical technology to scan physical documents or images and create digital representations of them.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent digital devices that are cameras.

comment.en: Cameras capable of acquiring still or motion pictures via an electronic sensor and storing them as digital information on a memory device.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are herbaria.

comment.en: Systematically arranged collections of pressed plant specimens that have been gathered in situ, then dried and pressed onto sheets of archival paper so that major morphological characteristics are preserved.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are maps.

comment.en: Refers to graphic or photogrammetric representations of the Earth's surface or a part of it, including physical features and political boundaries.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are books.

comment.en: Items comprising a collection of leaves of paper, parchment, wood, stiffened textile, ivory, metal tablets, or other flat material, that are blank, written on, or printed, and are strung or bound together.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are bound manuscripts.

comment.en: Ancient manuscripts generally taking the form of the modern book: bound leaves of paper or parchment with information inscribed on both faces, attached at a center fold.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are woodcuts.

comment.en: Prints made using the process of woodcut, which is a relief process in which the design is cut into and printed from the plank side of a wood block.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of publishers.

comment.en: The actions, functions, or event of issuing printed, taped, or otherwise reproduced records of knowledge or visual works in any medium for sale or distribution to the public.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of fresco paintings as a technique.

comment.en: Mural painting technique in which dry pigments are ground with water then brushed onto wet or partially dry lime plaster.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent software used for activities dealing with graphics.

comment.en: Software used to create computer graphics, or edit and otherwise manipulate existing graphics.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are handles.

comment.en: Tool handles, such as those of axes, hatchets, or hammers.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the activities of illustrators.

comment.en: The art or process of providing drawings or other pictures intended to elucidate a description, story, or other written material, usually in a book or periodical.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of oil paintings as a technique.

comment.en: The art or practice of producing creative works in oil paint, which is pigment suspended in vegetal drying oils.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are models.

comment.en: Refers to scaled or lifesize representations of objects, structures, beings, or other subjects, usually three-dimensional.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of taxidermy as a technique.

comment.en: Preparing lifelike representations of animals by stuffing the skin or molding it around a model of the specimen.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the processing phase in a digitisation process.

comment.en: Creating and manipulating data in a machine-readable form by means of computers, including inputting, storage, conversion, editing, and printing.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are printed volumes.

comment.en: Objects comprising sheets of paper, vellum, papyrus, or another material that are bound together. Volumes may include printed books, manuscripts, sketchbooks, or albums.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the metadata handling phase in a digitisation process.

comment.en: The process or function of gathering and recording information, especially to record facts or characteristics or to establish evidence or testimony.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the exporting phase of a digitisation process.

comment.en: The process or function of copying material or data to a computer drive, the cloud, or otherwise to a safe, more permanent location.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of sculpting as a technique.

comment.en: Refers to the process or branch of fine art concerned with creating sculpture, which are three-dimensional works.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent licenses and copyright statements.

comment.en: A formal statement of the copyright or licensing of a work, and/or any restrictions placed on it.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent the use of handwriting as a technique.

comment.en: The forming of letters and words by hand rather than by printing; may be used to designate a particular and distinctive form, style, or method of writing by hand.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are marine charts.

comment.en: Medieval marine charts, used before compasses, and for Medieval navigation manuals, illustrated with charts and showing the location of ports and other navigational information.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are visual works of art.

comment.en: Works of art, architecture, and any objects that occupy space, are perceived by the sense of sight, and are created or arranged, rather than naturally occurring.

rationale.value: This individual is used to represent CHOs that are medals.

comment.en: Small pieces of metal, usually gold, silver, or bronze and bearing a relief design on one or both sides and having a commemorative purpose.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crmdig:L10_had_input -[1]-> crmdig:D9_Data_Object
* crmdig:L11_had_output -[1]-> crmdig:D9_Data_Object
* crm:P4_has_time-span -[1]-> crm:E52_Time-Span
* crm:P11_had_participant -[0..N]-> crm:E74_Group
* crm:P14_carried_out_by -[1..N]-> crm:E39_Actor
* crmdig:L23_used_software_or_hardware -[1..N]-> crmdig:D14_Software

rationale.value: This class consists in a digitisation activity that follows the digital acquisition of a CHO. A software activity should at least be typified (through the combination of crm:P2_has_type and AAT), be assigned to its respective actors, have defined both its input and its output, have a time-span, and have the tool(s) used to carry it out.

comment.en: An activity in which a digital device runs a software program on a digital object.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:R129_is_about -[0..N]-> crm:E73_Information_Object
* lrmoo:R4i_is_embodied_in -[1..N]-> lrmoo:F3_Manifestation

rationale.value: This class represents the Expression level of conceptualisation as instructed by the LRM conceptual model. The Expression represents the content of a CHO, intended as the specific intellectual or artistic form that a Work takes each time it is realised.

comment.en: The realisation of a work, referring to the intellectual content of a cultural heritage object.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type

rationale.value: This class is used in conjunction with crm:P2_has_type and aat:300025976 to represent the concept of collection.

comment.en: A persistent physical item of any size that is purposely created by human activity.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crm:P130i_features_are_also_found_on -[0..N]-> lrmoo:F4_Manifestation
* lrmoo:R7i_is_exemplified_by -[1..N]-> lrmoo:F5_Item

rationale.value: This class represents the Manifestation level of conceptualisation as instructed by the LRM conceptual model. The Manifestation represents the format of a CHO, intended as the result from the capture of one or more Expressions onto a carrier or set of carriers.

comment.en: The rendering of one or more expressions. It is defined by both the overall content and the form of its presentation. The substance of manifestation is not only signs, but also the manner in which they are presented to be consumed by users, including the kind of media adopted.

rationale.value: This class is indirectly used in conjunction with crm:P2_has_type as a typification mechanism that can be applied to a variety of cases (e.g. activities, CHOs, techniques, etc.). This mechanism allows one to rely on existing and well-established external vocabularies, such as the Getty's Art and Architecture Thesaurus (AAT), to do the heavy lifting in modelling named individuals.

comment.en: A categorical concept denoted by terms from thesauri and controlled vocabularies used to characterize and classify other entities.

rationale.value: This class is implicitly used in conjunction with crm:P70i_is_documented_in to represent external resources (e.g. copyright statements, authority records, etc.).

comment.en: An information object that makes propositions about reality.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P82a_begin_of_the_begin -[1]-> xsd:dateTime
* crm:P82b_end_of_the_end -[1]-> xsd:dateTime

rationale.value: This class represents a period of time defined within a starting date time and an ending date time. Both dates are declared in the following form 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss', as instructed by the XML Schema Definition (XSD).

comment.en: An abstract temporal extent having a beginning, an end and a duration.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* lrmoo:R17_created -[1]-> lrmoo:F2_Expression
* crm:P9_consists_of -[1..N]-> crm:E7_Activity
* crm:R32_used_general_technique -[0..N]-> crm:E55_Type
* lrmoo:R19_created_a_realisation_of -[1]-> lrmoo:F1_Item
* crm:P4_has_time-span -[1]-> crm:E52_Time-Span

rationale.value: This class represents the creation of the CHO at both the Work and Expression levels.

comment.en: An activity that represents the creation of an expression.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P70i_is_documented_in -[0..N]-> crm:E31_Document

rationale.value: This class represents a geograhical location, usually indicating the current residence of some actor.

comment.en: A geographical location.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type

rationale.value: This class is used to represent the tools used to carry out acquisition activities. A digital device should at least be typified through the combination of crm:P2_has_type and AAT.

comment.en: A technical tool that is used to process or produce digital objects.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* lrmoo:R10_has_member -[0..N]-> lrmoo:F1_Work
* crm:P102_has_title -[0..N]-> crm:E35_Title
* lrmoo:R3_is_realized_in -[1..N]-> lrmoo:F2_Expression

rationale.value: This class represents the Work level of conceptualisation as instructed by the LRM conceptual model. The Work represents the essence of a CHO, as it was thought out during its conception in the mind of its creator(s).

comment.en: The essence or conceptualisation of an endeavor.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crmdig:L1_digitized -[1]-> lrmoo:F5_Item
* crmdig:L11_had_output -[1]-> crmdig:D9_Data_Object
* crm:P4_has_time-span -[1]-> crm:E52_Time-Span
* crm:P11_had_participant -[0..N]-> crm:E74_Group
* crm:P14_carried_out_by -[1..N]-> crm:E39_Actor
* crm:P32_used_general_technique -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crm:P16_used_specific_object -[1..N]-> crmdig:D8_Digital_Device

rationale.value: This class is used to represent the acquisition activity that kickstarts the digitisation process. An acquisition activity should at least be associated with the CHO it digitises and its output (the raw DCHO), as well as its time-span, the actors involved in it, and both the technique and the tool(s) used to carry it out.

comment.en: An activity that results in the production of data objects functioning as digital representations of physical entities.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crm:P190_has_symbolic_content -[1]-> rdfs:Literal

rationale.value: This class represents a identifier given to the CHO at the Item level.

comment.en: A textual string assigned to a cultural heritage object in order to identify it uniquely within a given context.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type

rationale.value: This class is used to represent the software used to carry out software activities during the digitisation process.

comment.en: A computer program.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P130i_features_are_also_found_on -[0..N]-> crmdig:D9_Data_Object

rationale.value: This class is used to represent the DCHO produced at the end of each digitisation activity.

comment.en: A digital object that is the direct result of an activity in a digitization workflow.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P74_has_current_or_former_residence -[0..1]-> crm:E53_Place
* crm:P70i_is_documented_in -[0..N]-> crm:E31_Document

rationale.value: This class represents a person, usually involved in some sort of activity.

comment.en: An individual person.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crm:P67_refers_to -[0..1]-> lrmoo:F3_Manifestation
* crm:P70i_is_documented_in -[0..1]-> crm:E31_Document
* crm:P190_has_symbolic_content -[0..1]-> rdfs:Literal

rationale.value: This class consists in a generic abstract construct that can be used in conjunction with crm:P2_has_type to represent conceptual entities like rights statements and CHOs subjects.

comment.en: An immaterial item that has an objectively recognizable structure and is documented as a single unit.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P74_has_current_or_former_residence -[0..1]-> crm:E53_Place
* crm:P70i_is_documented_in -[0..N]-> crm:E31_Document

rationale.value: This class represents organisations and other entities made up by groups of actors.

comment.en: A unified group of people.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P1_is_identified_by -[1..N]-> crm:E42_Identifier
* crm:P3_has_note -[0..1]-> rdfs:Literal

rationale.value: This class represents the Item level of conceptualisation as instructed by the LRM conceptual model. The Item represents the single exemplar of a CHO, intended as an object physically localised.

example.value:
### Example of a CHO at the Item level, characterised by three identifiers and a description

        ex:32-item a lrmoo:F5_Item ;
            crm:P1_is_identified_by ex:32-item-identifier-01 ,
                ex:32-item-identifier-02 ,
                ex:32-item-identifier-03 ;
            crm:P3_has_note '''
                Essere umano ermafrodita 
                Human hermaphrodite (Monstrum humanum hermaphroditicum) 
                sec. XVI 
                16th century 
                BUB, 
                Ms. Aldrovandi, Tavole di animali, vol. 5, carta 86
                '''^^rdfs:Literal .

comment.en: This class comprises physical objects that were produced by a process involving a given manifestation.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P2_has_type -[1]-> crm:E55_Type
* crm:P190_has_symbolic_content -[1]-> rdfs:Literal

rationale.value: This class represents a title given to the CHO at the Work level.

comment.en: A textual string that functions as a title for a work.

description.undefined:
The properties that can be used with this class are:

* crm:P74_has_current_or_former_residence -[0..1]-> crm:E53_Place
* crm:P70i_is_documented_in -[0..N]-> crm:E31_Document

rationale.value: This class represents a generic entity with an agency, which can be either a person or an organisation.

comment.en: An individual person or a group of people, with the potential to perform intentional and accountable actions.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that during a digitisation activity one or more software are used to produce its output.

comment.en: This property associates a digitization activity with the software that was used during that activity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a person or an organisation resides in a certain place.

label.fr: a pour résidence actuelle ou antérieure

comment.en: This property describes the current or former place of residence of an actor.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that an activity happens within a time span, defined by precise starting and ending date times.

comment.en: This property associates a phenomenon with the time span during which that phenomenon was on-going.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the precise ending date time of a time span.

comment.en: This property describes the precise ending date and time of a time span.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the textual description of a CHO at the Item level (thus intended as an exemplar of the exhibition).

example.value:
### Example of the textual description of a CHO at the Item level

        ex:32-item a lrmoo:F5_Item ;
            crm:P3_has_note '''
                Essere umano ermafrodita 
                Human hermaphrodite (Monstrum humanum hermaphroditicum) 
                sec. XVI 
                16th century 
                BUB, 
                Ms. Aldrovandi, Tavole di animali, vol. 5, carta 86
            '''^^rdfs:Literal .

comment.en: This property contains the textual description of an entity.

label.pt: é o período de tempo de

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a CHO at the Work level has a title.

example.value:
### Example of a work bearing a title.
        
        :work a lrmoo:F1_Work ;
            crm:P102_has_title :title .
        
        :title a crm:E35_Title .

comment.en: This property associates a title with the work bearing that title.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the instances of fuzzy temporal descriptions of time spans (e.g. when a time span has no precise starting or ending date times).

comment.en: This property describes the maximum period of time within which a time span falls.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a CHO at the Item level can depict the content (the Expression) of another CHO.

comment.en: This property identifies some entity that is depicted by a physical object.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a digitisation activity uses some DCHO as input for producing another DCHO as an output.

comment.en: This property associates an activity in a digitization workflow with a digital object used as input for that activity.

rationale.value: This property is used to associate cultural heritage objects and digital models with existing resources that are somehow related to them, such as a digital record of a cultural heritage object or a 3D model used as a basis for producing another model.

comment.en: This property generalises the notions of “copy of” and “similar to” into a directed relationship, where the domain expresses the derivative or influenced item and the range the source or influencing item, if such a direction can be established. The property can also be used to express similarity in cases that can be stated between two objects only, without historical knowledge about its reasons.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the textual content of entities such as titles and identifiers.

comment.en: This property associates a symbolic object with a textual representation of its content.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the creation of an LRM Work entity.

example.value:
### Example of a work being created during a creation event.
        
        :expression-creation a lrmoo:F28_Expression_Creation ;
            lrmoo:R19_created_a_realisation_of :work .
        
        :work a lrmoo:F1_Work .

comment.en: This property associates an expression creation with the corresponding work.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a certain tool is used to carry out an activity, such as a LRM Item entity during a curation activity, or a digital scanner during an acquisition activity.

example.value:
### Example of a CHO being involved in a curation activity.
        
        :curation-activity a crm:E7_Activity ;
            crm:P16_used_specific_object :item .
        
        :item a lrmoo:F1_Item .

comment.en: This property describes the use of a tool for performing an activity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the creation of an LRM Expression entity.

example.value:
### Example of an expression being created in a creation event.
        
        :expression-creation a lrmoo:F28_Expression_Creation ;
            lrmoo:R17_created :expression .
        
        :expression a lrmoo:F2_Expression .

comment.en: This property associates the expression that was first externalised during a particular creation event with that particular creation event.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a digitisation activity produces some DCHO as an output starting from another DCHO used as its input.

comment.en: This property associates an activity in a digitization workflow with a digital object produced as a result of that activity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the participation of some person or organization to an activity, such as the creation of a CHO, or its digital acquisition.

example.value:
### Example of an actor participating in an activity.
        
        :event a crm:E5_Event ;
            crm:P11_had_participant :agent .
        
        :agent a crm:E39_Actor .

comment.en: This property describes the participation of one or more actors in an event.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the precise beginning date time of a time span.

comment.en: This property describes the precise beginning date and time of a time span.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the relation between a license or copyright statement (modelled as a crm:E73_Information_Object with type aat:300435434) and the external document (e.g. a Web page) that describes its legal implications, either in a technical or non-technical way.

comment.en: This property refers to the fact that a document describes some entity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent works composed of other works.

example.value:
### Example of a complex work made up by another work.
        
        :parent-work a lrmoo:F1_Work ;
            lrmoo:R10_has_member :another-work .
        
        :another-work a lrmoo:F1_Work .

comment.en: This property associates a complex work with a work that forms part of it.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the identification of CHOs as a reified relation between the CHO and its identifiers, each characterised by a series of attributes.

comment.en: This property describes the naming or identification of any real-world item by a name or any other identifier.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the type of an entity through a flexible, generalised modelling mechanism. This property turns the burden of typifying entities (and thus managing the related individuals) on any external controlled vocabulary that is compatible with RDF representations, such as the Getty's Art and Architecture Thesaurus (AAT).

comment.en: This property allows typing of an entity through the use of an external knowledge organization system, such as a thesaurus or a controlled vocabulary.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that the creation of a CHO often consists of a set of smaller activities involving different people, techniques, and other aspects that cannot be related to a single entity.

comment.en: This property associates a period of time with another period of time it contains.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the technique employed during an activity, and especially during the creation of CHOs and DCHOs. This property turns the burden of defining techniques (and thus the related individuals) on any external controlled vocabulary that is compatible with RDF representations, such as the Getty's Art and Architecture Thesaurus (AAT).

comment.en: This property identifies the technique or method that was employed during an activity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that an acquisition activity digitises some CHO to produce a DCHO as an output.

comment.en: This property associates a digitization process with the cultural heritage object that is being digitized.

rationale.value: This property is used to model the relation between the Manifestation and the Expression LRM entities.

example.value:
### Example of a Manifestation embodying an Expression.
        
        :manifestation a lrmoo:F3_Manifestation ;
            lrmoo:R4_embodies :expression .
        
        :expression a lrmoo:F2_Expression .

comment.en: This property associates a Manifestation with one or more expressions which are rendered by this manifestation.

rationale.value: This property is used to model the relation between the Work and the Expression LRM entities.

example.value:
### Example of a work realised in an expression.
        
        :work a lrmoo:F1_Work ;
            lrmoo:R3_is_realised_in :expression .
        
        :expression a lrmoo:F2_Expression .

comment.en: This property associates an expression with a work.

label.de: ist derzeitiger oder früherer Sitz von
label.ru: является текущим или бывшим местом жительства для
label.en: is current or former residence of
label.fr: est la résidence actuelle ou antérieure de

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the relation between a license or copyright statement (modelled as a crm:E73_Information_Object with type aat:300435434) and the CHO it is attached to.

comment.en: This property documents that a propositional object refers to some entity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the direct responsibility of a person carrying out an activity, such as the acquisition of a CHO, its curation, its creation, etc.

example.value:
### Example of a person carrying out an acquisition activity.
        
        :acquisition a crmdig:D2_Digitization_Process ;
            crm:P14_carried_out_by :researcher .
        
        :researcher a crm:E21_Person .

comment.en: This property describes the active, accountable participation of an actor during an activity.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent topics of CHOs at their Expression level.

comment.en: This property documents that an expression has some entity as its topic.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a CHO at the Item level can be composed of other CHOs at the Item level.

comment.en: This property associates a physical entity with another physical entity that forms part of it.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the fact that a curation activity involves a collection a CHO is part of.

example.value:
### Example of a curation activity involving a collection.
        
        :curation-activity a crm:E7_Activity ;
            crm:P12_occurred_in_the_presence_of :collection .
        
        :collection a crm:E24_Physical_Human-Made_Thing .

label.fr: a eu lieu en présence de

comment.en: This property describes the presence of an entity during an event, without implying any specific role.

rationale.value: This property is used to represent the relation between the Item and Manifestation LRM entities.

example.value:
### Example of a item exemplifying a manifestation.
        
        :item a lrmoo:F5_Item ;
            lrmoo:R7_exemplifies :manifestation .
        
        :manifestation a lrmoo:F3_Manifestation .

comment.en: This property associates a manifestation with an item that is one of its exemplars or its only exemplar.
